metadata.title: CVE-2023-24329 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue in the urllib.parse component of Python before 3.11.4 allowsattackers to bypass blocklisting methods by supplying a URL that startswith blank characters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm5').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm8').
